results.content: Love is a serious mental disease.
results.author: Plato

results.content: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
results.author: Plato

results.content: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
results.author: Plato

results.content: Change in all things is sweet.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
results.author: Socrates

results.content: Well begun is half done.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
results.author: Plato

results.content: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: A friend to all is a friend to none.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
results.author: Plato

results.content: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
results.author: Plato

results.content: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: He who hath many friends hath none.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: Quality is not an act; it is a habit.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: Criticism is something you can easily avoid by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.
results.author: Aristotle

results.content: Be as you wish to seem.
results.author: Socrates

results.content: Wisdom begins in wonder.
results.author: Socrates

results.content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
results.author: Socrates
